sentences.english: Most people with eating disorders are very hard on themselves.
sentences.chinese: 大部分有进食障碍的人会对自己很严苛。

sentences.english: When Shelly says he's the harshest grader on campus, he isn't lying.
sentences.chinese: 当薛立说他是全校评级最严苛的老师时，他没有撒谎。

sentences.english: Brunette girl, Megumi Haruka, screams in harsh manners.
sentences.chinese: 黑发女孩，恵春香，尖叫声在严苛方式。

sentences.english: And for exactly that reason, the climate in London was growing harsher.
sentences.chinese: 也正因为此，伦敦的政治气候越来越严苛。

sentences.english: In practice, the hukou system is no longer as strictly enforced as before.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，户籍制度已经不像从前那样严苛了。

sentences.english: It is indicated for high power 4-stroke bikes for sporting or very demanding riding.
sentences.chinese: 特制用于大马力的运动或严苛条件的四冲程机车。
其他人觉得等级制度太严苛。

sentences.english: The quality criterion of non - oriented silicon steel becomes strictly.
sentences.chinese: 无取向硅钢板形质量要求日趋严苛。

sentences.english: For other people we're a lot less forgiving.
sentences.chinese: 我们对己宽容，对人严苛。

sentences.english: You'll be prone to tears if your mate is harsh with you this week.
sentences.chinese: 这周如果爱人对你过于严苛，你很容易就以眼洗面哦。

sentences.english: Kagan's reputation as a harsh grader is unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 关于卡刚严苛评级的坏名声属无中生有。

sentences.english: A tough new immigration law goes into effect in Britain Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 英国自周二起实行新的移民法，比以前严苛。

sentences.english: These outlets have all found innovative ways around the Zimbabwean government's restrictive laws.
sentences.chinese: 这些媒体都找到办法，避过辛巴威法律的严苛规定。

sentences.english: In emergencies, people too can eat the leaves to avoid starvation.
sentences.chinese: 甚至在一些严苛时刻，人们也可以食用树叶充饥。

sentences.english: The solutions are draconian, ” he said in an appearance at MIT.
sentences.chinese: “这些决议很严苛，”在一次MIT的亮相中他说道。

sentences.english: However, in the rigorous realistic situations, his imaginations were full of ornate indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 在严苛的现实境遇中，他的想象却是绮靡而放纵的。

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to request/to require/requirement/to stake a claim/to ask/to demand/CL:點|点[dian3]
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to regard as important/to care about
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
character/intrinsic quality (of a person)/quality (of a product or service, or as in "quality of life", "air quality" etc)
